{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations Officer",
  "description": "Rentachef NG is a leading catering, hospitality consulting, and chef rental agency in Nigeria. The company provides private chef service to customers across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikate, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage daily operations of clients service booking and assigning of chefs.
	Ensure high standards of clients satisfaction and supporting quality delivery of chefs.
	Collaborate with the procurement team/officer to maintain high delivery of food quality, procurement and logistics for clients.
	Manage workflows, supervising staff, and ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures.
	Ensure smooth operational processes to increase efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance customer satisfaction.
	Handle operational data/information, including residential chef subscription, chef work schedule, work location and client&rsquo;s information.
	Track metrics, analyze trends and provide insights to aid business decisions.
	Foster effective communication across departments, ensuring seamless collaboration and issue resolution.
	Assist in identifying and resolving operational issues, escalating to Admin/MD as necessary.


Requirements
Education


	B.Sc in Business Administration, Mass Communication or Social Science or Hospitality related degree.


Experience:


	At least 3 years of work experience in a well structured hospitality or food service company.
	MUST have experience in restaurant operations and experience dealing with chefs.


OtherRequirements:


	Proximity to Ikate and Lekki phase 1 is desirable.


Skills:


	Excellent communication: listening, written and verbal.
	Strong initiative and analytical mind.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
	Willing to learn fast.
	Strong initiative and ability to work efficiently under severe pressure.
	Proven problem solving skills.
	Ability to work underminimal supervision.
	Exceptional leadership and team building skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;rentachefrecruit@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Rentachef"
    
  },

Operations Officer Job at Rentachef NG




        
    

        
        Rentachef NG is a leading catering, hospitality consulting, and chef rental agency in Nigeria. The company provides private chef service to customers across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Officer

Job Location: Ikate, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage daily operations of clients service booking and assigning of chefs.
	Ensure high standards of clients satisfaction and supporting quality delivery of chefs.
	Collaborate with the procurement team/officer to maintain high delivery of food quality, procurement and logistics for clients.
	Manage workflows, supervising staff, and ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures.
	Ensure smooth operational processes to increase efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance customer satisfaction.
	Handle operational data/information, including residential chef subscription, chef work schedule, work location and client’s information.
	Track metrics, analyze trends and provide insights to aid business decisions.
	Foster effective communication across departments, ensuring seamless collaboration and issue resolution.
	Assist in identifying and resolving operational issues, escalating to Admin/MD as necessary.


Requirements
Education


	B.Sc in Business Administration, Mass Communication or Social Science or Hospitality related degree.


Experience:


	At least 3 years of work experience in a well structured hospitality or food service company.
	MUST have experience in restaurant operations and experience dealing with chefs.


OtherRequirements:


	Proximity to Ikate and Lekki phase 1 is desirable.


Skills:


	Excellent communication: listening, written and verbal.
	Strong initiative and analytical mind.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
	Willing to learn fast.
	Strong initiative and ability to work efficiently under severe pressure.
	Proven problem solving skills.
	Ability to work underminimal supervision.
	Exceptional leadership and team building skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: rentachefrecruit@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "AIICO Insurance Plc is an insurance, pensions management, and asset management Group in Nigeria, with market-leading positions in life assurance, annuity, general insurance, special risks, pension management, health insurance, and asset management. Established in 1963, AIICO Insurance Plc has a strong retail distribution network and is listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Group Life Underwriting Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Preparation of Group Life Quotation
	Preparation of Policy Documents for new client
	Medical underwriting
	Registration of New Business on Turnquest
	Processing of Claims settlement in conjunction with claims &amp; Benefit Unit
	Maintaining Group Life Database Portfolio
	Settling of Brokers or Agents Commission

	Maintaining of Client&rsquo;s Record and servicing

	Brokers Management

	Monthly Preparation of Production report for actuarial valuation
	NAICOM monthly report
	EDMS upload of transactions
	Responsible for coordinating the unit&rsquo;s schemes and providing support to the sales team in achieving set targets.


Requirements

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;arahman@aiicoplc.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Group Life Underwriting Officer Job at AIICO Insurance Plc




        
    

        
        AIICO Insurance Plc is an insurance, pensions management, and asset management Group in Nigeria, with market-leading positions in life assurance, annuity, general insurance, special risks, pension management, health insurance, and asset management. Established in 1963, AIICO Insurance Plc has a strong retail distribution network and is listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Group Life Underwriting Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Preparation of Group Life Quotation
	Preparation of Policy Documents for new client
	Medical underwriting
	Registration of New Business on Turnquest
	Processing of Claims settlement in conjunction with claims & Benefit Unit
	Maintaining Group Life Database Portfolio
	Settling of Brokers or Agents Commission
	Client’s Services
	Maintaining of Client’s Record and servicing
	Preparation of Renewal Notices
	Preparation of group life insurance certificate
	Daily Input Of Transactions On Turnquest Database
	Brokers Management
	Preparation of weekly production report
	Monthly Preparation of Production report for actuarial valuation
	NAICOM monthly report
	EDMS upload of transactions
	Responsible for coordinating the unit’s schemes and providing support to the sales team in achieving set targets.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 6 -12 years of experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: arahman@aiicoplc.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media & Content Administrator",
  "description": "F10 Studio is a photography and videography studio known for telling love stories through emotive, authentic, and visually stunning imagery. Based in Toronto with a growing footprint in Nigeria and globally, we specialize in weddings, portraiture, and storytelling-driven content creation. We pride ourselves on delivering a premium client experience from the first email to the final gallery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Social Media &amp; Content Administrator

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Key Responsibilities
Content Scheduling &amp; Posting:


	Upload and schedule content across Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Threads, Pinterest, TikTok, and YouTube using scheduling tools like Meta Business Suite, Later, or Buffer.
	Write engaging, well-structured captions that align with our brand voice and storytelling style.
	Select appropriate hashtags and post types to maximize reach and engagement.


Content Organization:


	Sort and organize images and videos from shoots for social use.
	Work with the creative team to maintain a ready-to-use content library.
	Maintain story highlight folders and update bios and links regularly.


Community Management:


	Monitor comments, DMs, and mentions&mdash;responding promptly and professionally.
	Identify and flag potential leads, collaborations, or inquiries for follow-up.


Analytics &amp; Reporting:


	Track weekly and monthly engagement stats, follower growth, and post performance.
	Provide monthly insights to guide content strategy and boost performance.


Trend Research &amp; Creative Input:


	Stay updated on wedding, photography, and social media trends.
	Provide input on content ideas, reels concepts, carousel posts, and IG Stories.
	Suggest ways to grow reach organically and attract ideal clients.


Requirements
Required Skills &amp; Must-Haves:


	1-2 years of experience managing social media pages (can include internships, freelance, or personal brand work)
	Excellent written English and copywriting skills
	Strong attention to detail and aesthetic sense, especially when working with photo/video content
	Experience using Instagram, Facebook, Twitter (X), Threads, and TikTok as a business/creator
	Strong organizational and time-management skills
	Able to work independently and take initiative with minimal supervision


Technical Requirements:
To succeed in this remote position, you MUST HAVE the following:


	A reliable computer
	Stable electricity
	High-speed internet connection
	A smartphone for real-time communication and coordination


Bonus (Nice to Have, But Not Required):


	Familiarity with Canva, Adobe Lightroom, or basic image editing
	Experience working in the photography, wedding, or creative industries
	Understanding of SEO, Pinterest strategies, or email marketing
	Comfortable using Google Drive, Notion, Trello, or Meta Business Suite


What We Offer


	Salary: N150,000 Monthly.
	Opportunity to work with a growing international brand in the creative industry
	Starting salary range for this role is N150,000 monthly
	Flexible remote work schedule
	Growth opportunities in content strategy and digital marketing
	Exposure to luxury weddings, events, and creative production
	Creative freedom in shaping our digital storytelling
	A supportive, collaborative, and creative remote team

Social Media & Content Administrator Job at F10 Studio




        
    

        
        F10 Studio is a photography and videography studio known for telling love stories through emotive, authentic, and visually stunning imagery. Based in Toronto with a growing footprint in Nigeria and globally, we specialize in weddings, portraiture, and storytelling-driven content creation. We pride ourselves on delivering a premium client experience from the first email to the final gallery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media & Content Administrator

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Key Responsibilities
Content Scheduling & Posting:
     

            
    




	Upload and schedule content across Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Threads, Pinterest, TikTok, and YouTube using scheduling tools like Meta Business Suite, Later, or Buffer.
	Write engaging, well-structured captions that align with our brand voice and storytelling style.
	Select appropriate hashtags and post types to maximize reach and engagement.


Content Organization:


	Sort and organize images and videos from shoots for social use.
	Work with the creative team to maintain a ready-to-use content library.
	Maintain story highlight folders and update bios and links regularly.


Community Management:


	Monitor comments, DMs, and mentions—responding promptly and professionally.
	Identify and flag potential leads, collaborations, or inquiries for follow-up.


Analytics & Reporting:


	Track weekly and monthly engagement stats, follower growth, and post performance.
	Provide monthly insights to guide content strategy and boost performance.


Trend Research & Creative Input:


	Stay updated on wedding, photography, and social media trends.
	Provide input on content ideas, reels concepts, carousel posts, and IG Stories.
	Suggest ways to grow reach organically and attract ideal clients.


Requirements
Required Skills & Must-Haves:


	1-2 years of experience managing social media pages (can include internships, freelance, or personal brand work)
	Excellent written English and copywriting skills
	Strong attention to detail and aesthetic sense, especially when working with photo/video content
	Experience using Instagram, Facebook, Twitter (X), Threads, and TikTok as a business/creator
	Strong organizational and time-management skills
	Able to work independently and take initiative with minimal supervision


Technical Requirements:
To succeed in this remote position, you MUST HAVE the following:


	A reliable computer
	Stable electricity
	High-speed internet connection
	A smartphone for real-time communication and coordination


Bonus (Nice to Have, But Not Required):


	Familiarity with Canva, Adobe Lightroom, or basic image editing
	Experience working in the photography, wedding, or creative industries
	Understanding of SEO, Pinterest strategies, or email marketing
	Comfortable using Google Drive, Notion, Trello, or Meta Business Suite


What We Offer


	Salary: N150,000 Monthly.
	Opportunity to work with a growing international brand in the creative industry
	Starting salary range for this role is N150,000 monthly
	Flexible remote work schedule
	Growth opportunities in content strategy and digital marketing
	Exposure to luxury weddings, events, and creative production
	Creative freedom in shaping our digital storytelling
	A supportive, collaborative, and creative remote team
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Full-Stack React Native Developer",
  "description": "Bluconvalley Limited is a technology-driven company specializing in innovative software design, development, and deployment. We build custom web and mobile solutions that help businesses streamline operations, enhance user experience, and drive digital transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full-Stack React Native Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(Onsite)
Working Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM &ndash; 5:00 PM

About the Role


	We&rsquo;re hiring a Full-Stack React Native Developer who can ship production-grade mobile apps end-to-end.
	You&rsquo;ll build beautiful, fast React Native apps, design/consume APIs, integrate payments and notifications, and handle releases to the App Store and Google Play.
	If you&rsquo;re comfortable moving from Figma &rarr; mobile UI &rarr; backend endpoints &rarr; analytics and CI/CD, this is for you.


What You&rsquo;ll Do
Mobile App Development:


	Build React Native (TypeScript) apps with great UX, navigation, animations, and offline-first patterns.
	Implement state management (Redux/Zustand/Jotai), data fetching (React Query/RTK Query), deep linking, and push notifications (FCM/APNs).
	Optimize performance: bundle size, memory, FPS, startup time, image/video handling.


Backend &amp; APIs:


	Design, build, and document REST/GraphQL APIs with Node.js (Express/NestJS).
	Model data in PostgreSQL/Supabase (Prisma/TypeORM/Drizzle), add caching with Redis, and handle auth (JWT/OAuth, role-based permissions).
	Build real-time features with Socket.IO (chat, presence, live updates).


Integrations &amp; Platform:


	Integrate payments (Paystack/Flutterwave/Stripe), file storage, maps/location, and third-party SDKs.
	Add analytics/crash reporting (Firebase/Amplitude/Sentry) and event tracking (GA4).


Delivery &amp; Quality:


	Set up CI/CD for mobile (Expo EAS/Fastlane) and backend (GitHub Actions); manage code signing and store submissions.
	Write tests (Jest, React Native Testing Library, supertest), perform code reviews, and maintain clean documentation.


Must-Have Skills


	1+ years building production mobile apps with React Native + TypeScript (published apps preferred).
	Strong UI implementation from Figma to pixel-perfect components (Tailwind-RN/StyleSheet).
	Solid backend experience with Node.js (Express/NestJS), PostgreSQL/Supabase, Prisma/TypeORM/Drizzle, Redis.
	Comfortable with auth, file uploads, webhooks, rate limiting, secure storage (Keychain/Keystore).
	Real-time systems (Socket.IO); background tasks, queues, notifications.
	Store release experience: provisioning profiles, certificates, versioning, staged rollouts.
	Git proficiency (branches, PRs, reviews) and a product mindset (measure &rarr; learn &rarr; iterate).
	Native modules/bridging (Android/iOS) or experience with Expo config plugins.
	Nice to have: WebRTC (calls/streams), media processing, map-heavy apps.
	Basic DevOps (Docker), cloud (AWS/Vercel/Supabase), observability (logs, metrics, tracing).
	Payment/KYC flows in the Nigerian market; awareness of local device/network constraints.
	You use AI productively (scaffold tests, generate variants, summarize logs) while writing your own clean, maintainable code. We value shipped, real-world work over tutorial demos.


What We Care About:


	Show us things you&rsquo;ve shipped: the problem, your role, the stack, and measurable impact (performance, retention, crashes, conversion, etc.).


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;bluconvalley@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and their name as the subject of the mail.

Note


	If you are looking for a remote role: please do not apply!!!
	This role is not for beginners, AI-assisted coders or vibe coders.
	We&#39;re looking for real developers with hands-on experience building functional apps that people actually use.
	If you&rsquo;ve built real-world projects and have a portfolio that shows off your skill and attention to detail, we want to hear from you.


If this sounds like you:


	Send your portfolio (GitHub, live projects, or case studies)
	Include your contact information for interview scheduling.


Additional Notes:


	This is an onsite role.
	You must be able to work from our office in Badore &ndash; Ajah, Lagos.
	You&rsquo;ll be joining a fast-moving environment where results matter more than buzzwords.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-15",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Bluconvalley Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "value": "187378"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",

      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Full-Stack React Native Developer Job at Bluconvalley Limited




        
    

        
        Bluconvalley Limited is a technology-driven company specializing in innovative software design, development, and deployment. We build custom web and mobile solutions that help businesses streamline operations, enhance user experience, and drive digital transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full-Stack React Native Developer

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)
Working Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM

About the Role
     

            
    




	We’re hiring a Full-Stack React Native Developer who can ship production-grade mobile apps end-to-end.
	You’ll build beautiful, fast React Native apps, design/consume APIs, integrate payments and notifications, and handle releases to the App Store and Google Play.
	If you’re comfortable moving from Figma → mobile UI → backend endpoints → analytics and CI/CD, this is for you.


What You’ll Do
Mobile App Development:


	Build React Native (TypeScript) apps with great UX, navigation, animations, and offline-first patterns.
	Implement state management (Redux/Zustand/Jotai), data fetching (React Query/RTK Query), deep linking, and push notifications (FCM/APNs).
	Optimize performance: bundle size, memory, FPS, startup time, image/video handling.


Backend & APIs:


	Design, build, and document REST/GraphQL APIs with Node.js (Express/NestJS).
	Model data in PostgreSQL/Supabase (Prisma/TypeORM/Drizzle), add caching with Redis, and handle auth (JWT/OAuth, role-based permissions).
	Build real-time features with Socket.IO (chat, presence, live updates).


Integrations & Platform:


	Integrate payments (Paystack/Flutterwave/Stripe), file storage, maps/location, and third-party SDKs.
	Add analytics/crash reporting (Firebase/Amplitude/Sentry) and event tracking (GA4).


Delivery & Quality:


	Set up CI/CD for mobile (Expo EAS/Fastlane) and backend (GitHub Actions); manage code signing and store submissions.
	Write tests (Jest, React Native Testing Library, supertest), perform code reviews, and maintain clean documentation.


Must-Have Skills


	1+ years building production mobile apps with React Native + TypeScript (published apps preferred).
	Strong UI implementation from Figma to pixel-perfect components (Tailwind-RN/StyleSheet).
	Solid backend experience with Node.js (Express/NestJS), PostgreSQL/Supabase, Prisma/TypeORM/Drizzle, Redis.
	Comfortable with auth, file uploads, webhooks, rate limiting, secure storage (Keychain/Keystore).
	Real-time systems (Socket.IO); background tasks, queues, notifications.
	Store release experience: provisioning profiles, certificates, versioning, staged rollouts.
	Git proficiency (branches, PRs, reviews) and a product mindset (measure → learn → iterate).
	Native modules/bridging (Android/iOS) or experience with Expo config plugins.
	Nice to have: WebRTC (calls/streams), media processing, map-heavy apps.
	Basic DevOps (Docker), cloud (AWS/Vercel/Supabase), observability (logs, metrics, tracing).
	Payment/KYC flows in the Nigerian market; awareness of local device/network constraints.
	You use AI productively (scaffold tests, generate variants, summarize logs) while writing your own clean, maintainable code. We value shipped, real-world work over tutorial demos.


What We Care About:


	Show us things you’ve shipped: the problem, your role, the stack, and measurable impact (performance, retention, crashes, conversion, etc.).


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bluconvalley@gmail.com using the Job Position and their name as the subject of the mail.

Note


	If you are looking for a remote role: please do not apply!!!
	This role is not for beginners, AI-assisted coders or vibe coders.
	We're looking for real developers with hands-on experience building functional apps that people actually use.
	If you’ve built real-world projects and have a portfolio that shows off your skill and attention to detail, we want to hear from you.


If this sounds like you:


	Send your portfolio (GitHub, live projects, or case studies)
	Include your contact information for interview scheduling.


Additional Notes:


	This is an onsite role.
	You must be able to work from our office in Badore – Ajah, Lagos.
	You’ll be joining a fast-moving environment where results matter more than buzzwords.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Mechanical Engineer",
  "description": "Springfield Ago Limited is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Plan, execute and monitor preventive and corrective maintenance of: bottle filling lines, CSTR Reactors, Diesel and Gas Generator Set, Reciprocating and Rotary Air Compressors, Chilled Water System, PET and HDPE Bottle Manufacturing Machines, Centrifugal Pumps, AODD Pumps, Cooling Towers and Precess Tanks.
	Ensure the smooth functioning of mechanical, instrumentation and electrical systems across the plant.
	Minimise production downtime through quick diagnosis and resolution of equipment breakdowns.
	Develop and implement maintenance schedules and SOPs for all critical equipment.
	Lead a team of technicians and ensure timely maintenance and proper documentation.
	Maintain an up-to-date spare parts inventory and manage local procurement from Nigerian vendors.
	Coordinate closely with production, QC, Admin and warehouse departments to ensure operational alignment
	Liaise with OEMs and third-party vendors for technical support and service needs
	Ensure all maintenance activities comply with Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) regulations


Required Skill &amp; Qualifications


	B.E./B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering
	5-7 years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment (Preferably Agrochemical or Plastic Packaging Industry)
	Strong technical expertise in: Mechanical systems, Electrical control panels and instrumentation, Utility systems ( compressors, chillers, generators, pumps, etc)
	Proven hands-on experience in troubleshooting and repairing filling lines and rotating equipment
	Familiarity with CSTR reactors and chemical processes
	Proficiency in Nigeria spare parts sourcing, vendor development and cost management.


Method of Application

Mechanical Engineer Job at Springfield Ago Limited




        
    

        
        Springfield Ago Limited is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical Engineer

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Plan, execute and monitor preventive and corrective maintenance of: bottle filling lines, CSTR Reactors, Diesel and Gas Generator Set, Reciprocating and Rotary Air Compressors, Chilled Water System, PET and HDPE Bottle Manufacturing Machines, Centrifugal Pumps, AODD Pumps, Cooling Towers and Precess Tanks.
	Ensure the smooth functioning of mechanical, instrumentation and electrical systems across the plant.
	Minimise production downtime through quick diagnosis and resolution of equipment breakdowns.
	Develop and implement maintenance schedules and SOPs for all critical equipment.
	Lead a team of technicians and ensure timely maintenance and proper documentation.
	Maintain an up-to-date spare parts inventory and manage local procurement from Nigerian vendors.
	Coordinate closely with production, QC, Admin and warehouse departments to ensure operational alignment
	Liaise with OEMs and third-party vendors for technical support and service needs
	Ensure all maintenance activities comply with Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) regulations


Required Skill & Qualifications


	B.E./B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering
	5-7 years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment (Preferably Agrochemical or Plastic Packaging Industry)
	Strong technical expertise in: Mechanical systems, Electrical control panels and instrumentation, Utility systems ( compressors, chillers, generators, pumps, etc)
	Proven hands-on experience in troubleshooting and repairing filling lines and rotating equipment
	Familiarity with CSTR reactors and chemical processes
	Proficiency in Nigeria spare parts sourcing, vendor development and cost management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: careers@kewalramnigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be shortlisted for an interview.
